channel.title: CVE Feed for Mozilla -- Focus for iOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Mozilla -- Focus for iOS

item.title: CVE-2024-5022|2024-05-17T18:42:24.791Z -- Mozilla -- Focus for iOS
item.description: The file scheme of URLs would be hidden, resulting in potential spoofing of a website's address in the location bar This vulnerability affects Focus for iOS < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-1563|2024-02-22T14:56:42.888Z -- Mozilla -- Focus for iOS
item.description: An attacker could have executed unauthorized scripts on top origin sites using a JavaScript URI when opening an external URL with a custom Firefox scheme and a timeout race condition. This vulnerability affects Focus for iOS < 122.

item.title: CVE-2024-0605|2024-01-22T18:23:24.614Z -- Mozilla -- Focus for iOS
item.description: Using a javascript: URI with a setTimeout race condition, an attacker can execute unauthorized scripts on top origin sites in urlbar. This bypasses security measures, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution or unauthorized actions within the user's loaded webpage. This vulnerability affects Focus for iOS < 122.

item.title: CVE-2024-0606|2024-01-22T18:23:25.606Z -- Mozilla -- Focus for iOS
item.description: An attacker could execute unauthorized script on a legitimate site through UXSS using window.open() by opening a javascript URI leading to unauthorized actions within the user's loaded webpage. This vulnerability affects Focus for iOS < 122.

item.title: CVE-2024-26284|2024-02-22T14:56:42.004Z -- Mozilla -- Focus for iOS
item.description: Utilizing a 302 redirect, an attacker could have conducted a Universal Cross-Site Scripting (UXSS) on a victim website, if the victim had a link to the attacker's website. This vulnerability affects Focus for iOS < 123.
